item.title: By: Valentino Vranken
item.dc:creator: Valentino Vranken
item.description: I always put tempdb as default. It's perfect to mess around with and I'm fairly sure dropping it will be a little more difficult. :)

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: I blogged about changing the db when connecting as well, see here <a href="/index.php/DataMgmt/DBAdmin/MSSQLServerAdmin/how-to-connect-to-sql">How to connect to SQL Server when your default database is unavailable</a>
item.content:encoded: I blogged about changing the db when connecting as well, see here How to connect to SQL Server when your default database is unavailable

item.title: By: Vishal
item.dc:creator: Vishal
item.content:encoded:
SQL Server also allows you to change the database while logging in. You can also use that if default database is not available::

http://sqlandme.com/2013/01/07/sql-server-login-failed-cannot-open-user-default-database/
